channel.title: Max CB - 200
channel.description:
So.. new blog came out talking about how the combat levels are now calculated making maxed combat at 200.
X + Defence level +2 = your Combat level. (X = your highest stat level from Magic, Ranged, Attack or Strength).
I really do not understand why they did not add the other 3 in even though they say it will make it complex because they all have a huge impact. (prayer = turmoil, summoning = healing/pak yaks etc, hp = the new Armour will increase it etc) Also other stuff like training combat skills, slayer possibly fucked.
To further encourage everyone to fight creatures designed for their level, we are removing the Combat XP for fighting creatures more than 30 levels below you. Drops and Slayer XP will remain the same. As I mentioned above, all NPCs are being rebalanced with this in mind. Since we don’t have any top-end training creatures in the game (yet), players with a very high Combat level will find this 30 level range increased to 50
I like this, so no more training to 99 from 1 on experiments/bandits etc. I just hope they change slayer so you do get XP if the combat level of a monster is below 30 or 50. Link to blog. http://services.runescape.com/m=news/og-blog-tradition-and-challenge

item.title: Max CB - 200
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

m1lkman:

The way you said [quote]It’s do with with something like, if you have better defense you can live longer.

Made it seem like defense level determine amount of Lifepoints.[/quote]

Well it kinda does in a way. The higher your defense level, the higher tier armour you can wear.

[/quote]Well, most MMORPG’s have it like that…

Defense level doesnt determine how many life points you have, the armor you are wearing does. Correct?[/quote]Yes

@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:131, topic:446091”]I don’t know how this is meant to remove pures…

99 Strength, 99 Attack, 1 defence, 99 others: lv 101.

Normal:
60 Strength, 60 attack, 40 defence, 60 others: lv 102.

Who’s going to win? -.-

EDIT:
Or are they making defence more of a necessity?[/quote]Yes, basically defense armors give a lot of lifepoints.

item.title: Max CB - 200
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:123, topic:446091”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=548950.msg4036871#msg4036871 date=1341275085]

Will the formula also be applied to npcs? Or are npcs just assigned set stat and hp quantities? Otherwise training will now be a pain in the ass

I believe Jagex said somewhere that their original combat formula wasn’t applied to NPCs to begin with, but don’t quote me on that. I remember trying to reverse engineer the stats a NPC would need to have to both a) match its combat level and b) match its hitpoints/damage capabilities. I ended up realizing that it was impossible to match them. I’m sure Jagex used some formulas to figure out NPC combat levels, but I doubt it was the same one used for players. For all we know, they may have used the one they’re about to give players.

@XP: I thought the beta uses a locally saved copy of your profile? Nothing is supposed to save on the game servers.
[/quote]
I reverse engineered some npcs by that way. It seemed pretty accurate as they always had even numbers it seemed.[/quote]

I’ve tried the same, and it doesn’t work out that well. I’m positive they said they don’t follow the formula for all NPCs. A good example is ahrim and karil, who were pushed to the same combat levels as the melee brothers.

@David: I agree as well. Attack and strength have equal potential in melee fighting. The only other thing the formula is missing is summoning, which they can’t figure out what to do with.

Edit: but honestly, I think Jagex is making a mistake trying to get rid of hybrids. It was one of the best aspects of the game.

Read full topic

item.title: Max CB - 200
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:124, topic:446091”]I still think instead of att/str being highest, it should be (att+str)/2

So instead of: Def lvl + 2 + highest of attack, str, range, or magic
it would be: Def lvl + 2 + highest of ((attack+str)/2), range, or magic[/quote]
I think Jagex wants more control over the balancing of Melee characters.
By assuming people’s Strength is equal to their Attack, it makes the job much easier for them.

By not calculating Herblore, Prayer, Summoning and HP you are giving people an easy choice when it comes to training those skills.

Read full topic

item.title: Max CB - 200
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I disagree, I think their logic for not including HP (LP being dictated by armor mostly) and Prayer (you will know if they are using high prayer) is sound.

Read full topic

item.title: Max CB - 200
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:124, topic:446091”]I still think instead of att/str being highest, it should be (att+str)/2

So instead of: Def lvl + 2 + highest of attack, str, range, or magic
it would be: Def lvl + 2 + highest of ((attack+str)/2), range, or magic[/quote]

That would be better. And I just thought… if they keep this formula then it’s 1 combat level per defense. Which I still think shouldn’t be the case. I still think it should include prayer even when it gets nerfed in EoC.

Read full topic

I ended up realizing that it was impossible to match them. I’m sure Jagex used some formulas to figure out NPC combat levels, but I doubt it was the same one used for players.
